word:
Christ's Love and Sympathy Drew the People.-- It was the outcast, the publican and sinner, the despised of the nations, that Christ called, and by His loving-kindness compelled to come unto Him. The one class that He would never countenance was those who stood apart in their self-esteem, and looked down upon others.--Ministry of Healing, p. 164. 
                                                                           83
